Mr O'Leary heavily criticised the directives after the volcanic ash cloud crisis, which led to airlines forking out millions in compensation to customers. He said: It is inequitable that airports enjoy a boost to their restaurant and retail revenues from stranded passengers when their runways close, yet the airlines are obliged to pay for meals, drinks and hotels, when these cancellations are outside our control. Ryanair is not the first airline to flag up the cost of severe weather disruption.
